intro: Rosa communis var. richteri, commonly known as the Richter rose, is a hybrid cultivar prized for its vibrant, fragrant flowers. It belongs to the Rosaceae family and is characterized by its semi-double to full bloom of pink to red petals. The plant typically grows as a shrub with thorny stems and dark green, serrated leaves. It thrives in well-drained soil and requires full sun for optimal flowering. This variety is often cultivated in gardens for its ornamental value and historical significance in rose breeding.
